Sounds cool! What exactly CAN the editor do? All I did was make a guy called 
"punkyguy" (and now the scenario editor won't work)...

----Original Message Follows----
From: "-Tevildo." <Tevildo@...>
Reply-To: gladiator@egroups.com
To: gladiator@egroups.com
Subject: [gladiator] Editor.exe
Date: Wed, 27 Sep 2000 08:46:16 EDT

Okay, if you're ready to take the extra step and add Editor.exe into your
level-making process, here's what I've learned...

tiles 0-133 can be used; other numbers are available in Editor but if you
use these it will crash Scen.exe or Glad.exe

tile 8 is the one I mentioned previously, the "permeable wall" which runs
vertical rather than horizontal (Use 'em, DPH!)

tiles 53 and 54 were apparently made funny, so I altered them into usable
column tiles--the Tevildo-altered versions are packed into TevFifty, if you
want to use them

Editor.exe can also be used to change the dimensions of a map, which I found
VERY useful, as some of my levels are very long one way and very thin the
other way. You can also use it to change all tiles of a particular type into
another type instantly. I suggest that everyone make a palette .PIX file
with samples of all 134 usable tiles, which you can pull up in Scen.exe for
easy access to any map pieces you could ever need. I'd simply send you mine,
but the Mailing List rules say no attachments. Anyway, I hope everyone can
use Editor successfully, as it's a powerful tool. I may use it to alter the
character images one of these days, but I have other projects to work on
first. Best of luck,
          -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
                  (http://hotyellow98.com/tevildo/glad.html)
